content:
@klonos I know you've mentioned Franz and Station in the past. I just moved off Station since I discovered Ferdi (which is a fork of Franz that's less "freemium" and more "open source").
https://getferdi.com/

Ferdi
All your favorite services in one place
I use Ferdi! :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes:

Thanks @Laryn :+1: ...I'll give it a go, since I'm having issues with Station:

  • on Mac, after some use (my MacBook is on almost 24/7), I lose my spelling ...at least on any Slack app
  • I never could get MS Teams to work on Station :shrug:
    ...besides, they recently decided to switch Station to a browser extension (that does "much more" ...which I don't want), and deprecate the "legacy" app + discontinue support for it (see https://stationhq.com/blog/a-new-era-for-station) ...so I was bound to look for an alternative. Having 2 people that I trust and know to be thorough reviewers/testers recommend one that they've been using and are happy with gives me confidence to try it :wink:
Be aware though, Ferdi is just a glorified browser AFAIK...

Thanks for the heads-up @BWPanda ...I'm gonna give it a go anyway ...this whole "rewrite" of Station on a different technology (the legacy app was built on Electron), and dropping support of the software + using the same namespace for the new software resembles the whole D7 vs D8 story, that I was constantly being reminded and put off :sweat_smile:
@Laryn are you using Ferdi on Mac? ...if so, did you manage to get spell-check to work in it?
I just started using it today but I'm pretty sure the spell check was working.
